questions.question: My name is Samuel. ........................... am a German.
questions.description: Only subject pronouns (I, he, she, it, you, they, we) can be used as the subject of a sentence.

questions.question: My grandparents live in Berlin. We visit ......................... often.
questions.description: They is a subject pronoun. Them is an object pronoun. Only object pronouns can be used as objects.

questions.question: Let ......................... help you carry these bags.
questions.description: Let is a verb and the pronoun that goes after it is its object. Therefore, we need an object pronoun here.

questions.question: Should ......................... help you carry these books?
Can ............... tell me where ................... can find a good restaurant?
James should stay back after school. ...................... has football practice.
questions.description: Only subject pronouns can be used as subjects.

questions.question: That pen is ........................... It is not ......................
questions.description: Words like mine and yours are possessive pronouns. They are used alone and indicate possession.

questions.question: This is ......................... bedroom. That is ....................
questions.description: Words like my, his, her and their are possessive adjectives. They go before a noun. Words like mine, hers, theirs, ours and yours are possessive pronouns. They are used alone.

questions.question: We can go to ..................... place or we can go to ....................
questions.description: Words like my, his, her and their are possessive adjectives. They go before a noun. Words like mine, hers, theirs, ours and yours are possessive pronouns. They are used alone.

questions.question: My birthday is on 18th May and ...................... is on 21st June.
questions.description: Her and hers are possessive forms. Her is a possessive adjective. It goes before a noun. Hers is a possessive pronoun. It goes alone.

questions.question: This is my jacket and that is .......................
questions.description: His can be a possessive pronoun and a possessive adjective.

questions.question: ......................... bag is this?
questions.description: Whose is the possessive form of who. Who's means who is or who has.
